column3: be prepared people will start arriving at the open. By 11:15
column4: all seats were full. That was a good sign already. A restaurant with that kind of regular traffic has to be good. Between two people
column5: we ordered a full slab of ribs with mac and cheese and cornbread and the brisket platter with a side of pulled pork
column7: beans and fries. First of all
column8: I am gluten and dairy free. I was so happy when the manager confirmed that all meats and sauces are gluten free. He also assured me that most of the sides were
column9: too. Including the fries!!! You have NO idea how happy I was since fries are usually a no-no since they share a fryer with gluten items.
